docs.snippet: THE notion that children should be seen and not heard still prevails to a large extent in South America, according to the observations of two recent visitors. The results, they believe, vary from desirable to highly questionable.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE notion that children should be seen and not heard still prevails to a large extent in South America, according to the observations of two recent visitors. The results, they believe, vary from desirable to highly questionable.

docs.snippet: FIFTY-SEVENTH STREET has long held the portion in music that Madison Avenue has gained in advertising. One of the factors that clinched the street's position was the opening in 1926 of the sixteen-story Steinway Building on the north side between...
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFTY-SEVENTH STREET has long held the portion in music that Madison Avenue has gained in advertising. One of the factors that clinched the street's position was the opening in 1926 of the sixteen-story Steinway Building on the north side between Seventh Avenue and the Avenue of the Americas.

docs.snippet: COLUMBIA, Mo., Feb. 28 (UPI) -- "Only when there is a strong free press can truth flourish," delegates to the Press Congress of the World were told here tonight on the eve of their world-wide meeting.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 28 -- Uruguay hands over her executive power for the next four years tomorrow to an 86-year-old politician, an ambitious radio commentator and the candidate most thoroughly beaten in the last election.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 28 -- Uruguay hands over her executive power for the next four years tomorrow to an 86-year-old politician, an ambitious radio commentator and the candidate most thoroughly beaten in the last election.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 1 -- After ninety-three years of unbroken opposition, the Nationalist party assumed power today in a change of government that carried on Uruguay's democratic traditions.
